</xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Enum_TransactionStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An identifier for where this message falls within a sequence of messages.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="EnumerationClosed">Enum_TransactionStatus</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="Start"/> <xsd:enumeration value="End"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Rollback"/> <xsd:enumeration value="InSeries"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Continuation"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Subsequent"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:complexType name="CodeList"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a codelist.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">CodeList</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">OpenTravel</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The source of the codelist.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Enum_CodelistSource_Base"> <xsd:attribute name="extension" type="ota2:String_EnumExtension"/> <xsd:attribute name="itemCode" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The numeric ID or code for the value from the code list.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">14</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="itemName" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The literal (textual) value from the code list.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Corporate Booking Information</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="listNameCode" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The acronym or code for the code list name.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ADT</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="openTravelListName" type="ota2:Enum_OpenTravelCodelist" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The OpenTravel code list name.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ADT:Additional Detail Type</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="otherListName" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of a third party (non-OpenTravel) code list.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">IATA Country Codes</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ContextualCode"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a contextual code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">ContextualCode</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ABC123</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A code up to 32 characters in length.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Tiny"> <xsd:attribute name="context" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The named context of the code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Owner</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="URL" type="ota2:URL" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A URL to the source owner of the code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">http://www.ABCCompany.com/somesource</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ContextualID"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a contextual identifier.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">ContextualID</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A unique ID up to 128 characters in length.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Short"> <xsd:attribute name="context" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The named context of the ID.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Owner</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="URL" type="ota2:URL" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A URL to the source owner of the ID.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">http://www.opentravel.org</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="ExchangeRate"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes an exchange rate.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">ExchangeRate</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">USD</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An ISO 4217 currency code for the base currency that's being converted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_ISO_Currency"> <xsd:attribute name="baseNUC" type="ota2:Money" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The base neutral unit of construction amount.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">100</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="exchangeDateTime" type="ota2:Date_DateTime" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The date and time of the conversion rate.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">2012-12-17T09:30:47</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="exchangeRate" type="xsd:decimal" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The rate used for conversion from the source currency to the target currency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">1.32932</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="exchangeSourceName" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the exchange rate source.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Exchange Rates.com</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="exchangeSourceURL" type="ota2:URL" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A URL for the source of the conversion rate.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">http://www.exchangerates.org.uk/US-Dollar-USD-currency-table.html</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="toCurrency" type="ota2:Code_ISO_Currency" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An ISO 4217 currency code for the final converted currency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">EUR</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="InitiatorAirline"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes airline information for a message requestor or sender.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">http://bit.ly/OTA2_IATA_AirlineCode</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">InitiatorAirline</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">UA</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A two character IATA airline vendor ID.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">http://bit.ly/OTA2_IATA_AirlineCode</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_IATA_AirlineID"> <xsd:attribute name="airportCode" type="ota2:Code_IATA_Airport" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A three character IATA assigned airport code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">http://bit.ly/OTA2_IATA_AirportCodes</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">JFK</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="erspCode" type="ota2:Code_IATA_ERSP" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The IATA airline Electronic Reservation Services Provider (ERSP) code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">http://bit.ly/OTA2_ERSP</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">An ERSP is a unique IATA (in cooperation with ATA and ARC) code used as a means of identification when performing online bookings with airlines.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">123456789</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="firstDeparturePoint" type="ota2:Code_IATA_City" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An IATA city code for the first departure point for a trip.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">http://bit.ly/OTA2_IATA_AirportCodes</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">JFK</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="InitiatorBookingChannel"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a booking channel.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">InitiatorBookingChannel</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Agent</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An extensible list of booking channel types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Enum_BookingChannel_Base"> <xsd:attribute name="extension" type="ota2:String_EnumExtension"/> <xsd:attribute name="code" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A code for the booking channel.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">12345</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="id" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A unique ID for the booking channel that is typically used for message authentication.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ABC1234567</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the booking channel.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">The Best Travel Company Public Website</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="primaryInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, the booking channel type is the primary means of connectivity used by the source.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="InitiatorID"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a unique ID and contextual information for the ID for a message requestor or sender.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">The ID and associated information should be known between trading partners.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">InitiatorID</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">vendor12345</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A unique identifier for the requestor or sender of the message.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">This ID should be known between trading partners.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Short"> <xsd:attribute name="context" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The contextual source of the requestor ID, such as IATA, ARC, and ERSP.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">IATA</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="url" type="ota2:URL" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A URL that identifies the location associated with the @context.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">http://www.vendor12345.com</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="InitiatorTravelAgent"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Sine ID and other metadata about a travel agency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">InitiatorTravelAgent</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">7854JL</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The travel agent sine identifier.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">A code used to identify a user or a travel agency, typically used by GDS.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Tiny"> <xsd:attribute name="companyName" type="ota2:Name_Proper" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the travel agency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ABC Travel Company</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="dutyCode" type="ota2:Code_AgentDuty" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A two to five character code (alpha, numeric or combination) code that specifies a travel agents duty code used for agency authentication.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">GS</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="pseudoCityCode" type="ota2:Code_PseudoCity" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A three to five character code (alpha, numeric or combination) that specifies a GDS code used to identify a travel agency location.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Note that this may be a required field when using negotiated rates to associate the rates to an agency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ORD</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="terminalID" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The electronic address of the device from which information is entered.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">01989</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Identifier_Country"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a country.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">Identifier_Country</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">USA</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A three character alpha country code defined in ISO 3166 format.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1_alpha-3</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_ISO_Country"> <xsd:attribute name="alpha2" type="ota2:String_Alpha2" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The two character alpha country code defined in ISO 3166 format.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">FR</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="fullName" type="ota2:Name_Proper" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the country.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">France</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Identifier_Currency"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a currency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">Identifier_Currency</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">USD</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A three character ISO 4217 currency code with other related metadata.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Reference">http://bit.ly/OTA2_ISO4217</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_ISO_Currency"> <xsd:attribute name="decimalPlaces" type="xsd:positiveInteger" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" for the number of decimal places for the associated currency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">2</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="pricingFilingInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the pricing/filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Identifier_Language"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a language.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">Identifier_Language</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">en</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A code for a language in ISO 639-1 (2 alpha character) format.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_ISO_Language"> <xsd:attribute name="alpha3" type="ota2:String_Alpha3" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The three character alpha language code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ENG</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the language for display purposes.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ENGLISH</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="primaryInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the primary (or preferred) language within a set of specified languages.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="MessagePassword"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a message password.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">MessagePassword</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">eK7@41!3aB</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A password associated with a message request.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Note that it is an OpenTravel Best Practice to encrpt any user identifying, personally identify or account access data.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Short"> <xsd:attribute name="domain" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The domain associated with the message password.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">CRS</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Processing_Currency"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes the currency used in a request message and the preferred response currency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">Processing_Currency</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Request and response currency information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_ISO_Currency"> <xsd:attribute name="decimalPlaces" type="xsd:positiveInteger" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An ISO 4217 standard "minor unit" for the number of decimal places for the associated currency.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">2</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="initiatorInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the currency that the initiating message is in.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="responseInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the requested currency for message responses.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="pricingFilingInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the pricing/filing currency.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Processing_Language"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes the language used in a request message and the preferred response language.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">Processing_Language</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Request and response language information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Code_ISO_Language"> <xsd:attribute name="alpha3" type="ota2:String_Alpha3" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The three character alpha language code.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ENG</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="name" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the language for display purposes.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ENGLISH</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="initiatorInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the language that the initiating message is in.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="responseInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the requested language for message responses.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="primaryInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, this is the primary (or preferred) language within a set of specified languages.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TargetSystem"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a target (or receiving) processing system.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">TargetSystem</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Production</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An extensible list of target message processing system types..</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Enum_TargetProcessingSystem_Base"> <xsd:attribute name="extension" type="ota2:String_EnumExtension"/> <xsd:attribute name="systemName" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The name of the target system that may be specified if there are more than one system for the specified system type.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Server3</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TimeWindow"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a date and optional time with a time period that can be applied before and/or after the date.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">TimeWindow</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">2012-12-17T09:30:47</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The date and optional time.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Date_DateTime"> <xsd:attribute name="windowAfter" type="ota2:Time_Duration" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A period of time that can be applied to the base date/time resulting in a later range of time.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">P3D</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="windowBefore" type="ota2:Time_Duration" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A period of time that can be applied to the base date/time resulting in an earlier range of time.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">PT12H</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="crossDateInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, the requested period may extend over the previous or following day. If false, the search period is restricted to the date/time specified.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Note that this indicator is typically used when the window duration is in hours.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TimeZone"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a time zone.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">TimeZone</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">ET</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The time zone name or abbreviation.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Tiny"> <xsd:attribute name="utcOffset" type="ota2:String_Tiny" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) time zone offset.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">A UTC offset is typically represented with a plus or minus sign, an hour increment and an hour designator, such as - 5h.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">- 5h</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="daylightSavingsInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, daylight (or summer) savings time is used in the time zone.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Transaction"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Metadata that describes a message transaction.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="ValueWithAttributes">Transaction</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTM2">12345</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The transaction ID.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Unique identifier to relate all messages within a transaction (e.g. this would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction).</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">This would be sent in all request and response messages that are part of an on-going transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:extension base="ota2:String_Short"> <xsd:attribute name="correlationID" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An ID for end-to-end correlation of log messages with the corresponding Web service message throughout the processing of the Web service message.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">6712</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="sequenceNumber" type="xsd:positiveInteger" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The sequence number of the transaction assigned by the sending system for ordered message processing or message resynchronization.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Message resynchronization typically is required if a system has been off-line and needs to retrieve messages that were missed.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">6</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="status" type="ota2:Enum_TransactionStatus" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Where this message falls within a sequence of messages.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Start</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="retransmissionInd" type="xsd:boolean" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">If true, the message is being re-sent after a failure.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">It is recommended that this attribute is used (i.e., set to TRUE) only when a message is retransmitted.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="DataPolicySubGrp" type="ota2:DataPolicy"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Information about data policy(s) that may apply to all or a portion of the message contents.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">DataPolicy</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DataPolicy" substitutionGroup="ota2:DataPolicySubGrp" type="ota2:DataPolicy"/> <xsd:element name="DataPolicySummary" substitutionGroup="ota2:DataPolicySubGrp" type="ota2:DataPolicy"/> <xsd:element name="DataPolicyDetail" substitutionGroup="ota2:DataPolicy" type="ota2:DataPolicy_Detail"/> <xsd:complexType name="DataPolicy"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Summary data policy information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">DataPolicy</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="1" name="type" type="ota2:Enum_DataPolicyType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An extensible list of data policy types.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="schemaFieldXPath" type="ota2:String_Medium" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An xPath to the tag of the schema element or attribute (field) that the data policy(s) applies to.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">AirInventoryQueryRQ/Traveler/@birthDate</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="DataPolicy_Detail"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Detail data policy information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">DataPolicy</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="ota2:DataPolicy"> <xsd:attribute name="description" type="ota2:String_Medium" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A brief description of the data policy intended to be used for logging and compliance purposes.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Restricted to internal sharing as needed-no third party sharing.</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="url" type="ota2:URL" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A URL to a source that describes the data policy.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">http://www.BTCCO.com/datapolicy.aspx</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="EncryptionSubGrp" type="ota2:Encryption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Information about encrypted elements and attributes within the message.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">Encryption</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Encryption" substitutionGroup="ota2:EncryptionSubGrp" type="ota2:Encryption"/> <xsd:element name="EncryptionSummary" substitutionGroup="ota2:EncryptionSubGrp" type="ota2:Encryption"/> <xsd:element name="EncryptionDetail" substitutionGroup="ota2:Encryption" type="ota2:Encryption_Detail"/> <xsd:complexType name="Encryption"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Summary payload information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">Encryption</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attribute name="schemaFieldXPath" type="ota2:String_Medium" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An xPath to the tag of the schema element or attribute (field) that is encrypted.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">AirInventoryQueryRQ/Traveler/@birthDate</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="value" type="xsd:string" use="required"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The encrypted value.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="Encryption_Detail"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Detail encryption information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">Encryption</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="ota2:Encryption"> <xsd:attribute name="method" type="ota2:String_Short" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The encryption method being used.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Note that if you do not specify the encryption method, it should be known to your trading partners.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Example context="OTM2">Triple DES</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="TransactionInitiatorSubGrp" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Transaction initiator identification, authentication and other associated summary and detail information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">TransactionInitiator</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="TransactionInitiator" substitutionGroup="ota2:TransactionInitiatorSubGrp" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator"/> <xsd:element name="TransactionInitiatorSummary" substitutionGroup="ota2:TransactionInitiatorSubGrp" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator"/> <xsd:element name="TransactionInitiatorDetail" substitutionGroup="ota2:TransactionInitiator" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator_Detail"/> <xsd:element name="PointOfSaleSubGrp" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Transaction initiator identification, authentication and other associated summary and detail information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">TransactionInitiator</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="PointOfSale" substitutionGroup="ota2:PointOfSaleSubGrp" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator"/> <xsd:element name="PointOfSaleSummary" substitutionGroup="ota2:PointOfSaleSubGrp" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator"/> <xsd:element name="PointOfSaleDetail" substitutionGroup="ota2:PointOfSale" type="ota2:TransactionInitiator_Detail"/> <xsd:complexType name="TransactionInitiator"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Summary transaction initiator information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">TransactionInitiator</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="1" name="ID" type="ota2:InitiatorID"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A unique identifier for the requestor or sender of the message with other metadata related to the ID.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="1" name="Type" type="ota2:Enum_UniqueID_Type"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An extensible list of requestor or sender types.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">This type should be known between trading partners.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="TransactionInitiator_Detail"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Detail transaction initiator information.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="CoreObject">TransactionInitiator</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="ota2:TransactionInitiator"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="Agent" type="ota2:InitiatorTravelAgent"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The travel agent sine number and other identification and authentication information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="Airline" type="ota2:InitiatorAirline"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The two character airline IATA vendor ID and other identification and authentication information.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="BookingChannel" type="ota2:InitiatorBookingChannel"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The type of the booking channel and other identification and authentication information for the requestor or sender.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="Company" type="ota2:String_Short"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Company information for the requestor or sender.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="RelativeLocation" type="ota2:String_Short"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The geographical location of the requestor.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="TimeZone" type="ota2:TimeZone"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A time zone abbreviation with other related metadata for the requestor or sender.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element minOccurs="0" name="TravelSector" type="ota2:Enum_TravelSector"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">The travel sector associated with the requestor or sender.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema targetNamespace="http://services.sabre.com/STL_Payload/v02_00" elementFormDefault="qualified" attributeFormDefault="unqualified" version="2.0.0" xmlns="http://services.sabre.com/STL_Payload/v02_00" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema" xmlns:msg="http://services.sabre.com/STL_MessageCommon/v02_00"> <xsd:import namespace="http://services.sabre.com/STL_MessageCommon/v02_00" schemaLocation="STL2_MsgCommon_v02_00.xsd"/> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Types and element definitions used as the base constructs for all message payloads.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:element name="STL_Payload" type="STL_Payload" abstract="true"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Create all message root elements as member of the substitution group with the element as the head. Global message types must be defined as an extension of the STL_Payload type.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:complexType name="STL_Payload"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>All message roots should be created as an extension of this base type. Global message elements must declare they are a member of the STL_Payload substitution group. This type may be used when an empty payload is needed for error handling.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:attribute name="version"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Version of the payload message.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:simpleType> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="255"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="STL_Request_Payload" substitutionGroup="STL_Payload" type="STL_Request_Payload" abstract="true"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Global message element for service requests.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:complexType name="STL_Request_Payload"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Base type for request messages.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="STL_Payload"/> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="STL_Response_Payload" substitutionGroup="STL_Payload" type="STL_Response_Payload" abstract="true"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Global message element for service responses.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:complexType name="STL_Response_Payload"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Base type for response messages.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="STL_Payload"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="ApplicationResults" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="STL_Notif_Payload" substitutionGroup="STL_Payload" type="STL_Notif_Payload" abstract="true"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Global message element for service notifications.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:complexType name="STL_Notif_Payload"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Base type for notification messages.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="STL_Payload"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element ref="ApplicationResults" minOccurs="0"/> </xsd:sequence> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="Results" type="Results" abstract="true"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Results is an abstract type to be used as a substitution group head. ApplicationResults is an example of its intended usage.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:complexType name="Results"/> <xsd:element name="ApplicationResults" type="ApplicationResults" substitutionGroup="Results"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>ApplicationResults can be used anywhere where Results is referenced, specifically as the contents of a Sabre SOAP Fault/detail element.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:complexType name="ApplicationResults"> <xsd:complexContent> <xsd:extension base="Results"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="Success" type="ProblemInformation" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="99"/> <xsd:element name="Error" type="ProblemInformation" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="99"/> <xsd:element name="Warning" type="ProblemInformation" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="99"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="status" type="msg:CompletionCodes" use="required"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:complexContent> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:element name="ProblemInformation" type="ProblemInformation"/> <xsd:complexType name="ProblemInformation"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="SystemSpecificResults" type="SystemSpecificResults" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="99"/> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="type" type="msg:ErrorType"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An indication of the source of error when processing the request.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> <xsd:attribute name="timeStamp" type="xsd:dateTime"/> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="SystemSpecificResults"> <xsd:sequence> <xsd:element name="HostCommand" type="HostCommand" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Host system command run to create this result.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Message" type="msg:Message.Condition" minOccurs="0" maxOccurs="99"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>Application specific code and Message. A textual description to provide more information about the specific condition, warning or error with code attribute as numeric value.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="ShortText" type="msg:Text.Short" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>An abbreviated version of the error in textual format.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="Element" type="msg:Text.Long" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If present, this attribute may identify an unknown or misspelled tag that caused an error in processing. It is recommended that the Tag attribute use XPath notation to identify the location of a tag in the event that more than one tag of the same name is present in the document. Alternatively, the tag name alone can be used to identify missing data [Type=ReqFieldMissing].</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="RecordID" type="msg:Identifier" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If present, this attribute allows for batch processing and the identification of the record that failed amongst a group of records. This value may contain a concatenation of a unique failed transaction ID with specific record(s) associated with that transaction.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> <xsd:element name="DocURL" type="xsd:anyURI" minOccurs="0"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If present, this attribute refers to an online description of the error that occurred.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:element> </xsd:sequence> <xsd:attribute name="timeStamp" type="xsd:dateTime"/> <xsd:attribute name="reference" type="xsd:IDREF" use="optional"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation>If present, this attribute provides an XML IDREF to the elemenet for which the results apply.</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:attribute> </xsd:complexType> <xsd:complexType name="HostCommand"> <xsd:simpleContent> <xsd:extension base="msg:Text.Long"> <xsd:attribute name="LNIATA" type="xsd:string" use="optional"/> </xsd:extension> </xsd:simpleContent> </xsd:complexType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:schema attributeFormDefault="unqualified" elementFormDefault="qualified" targetNamespace="http://www.opentravel.org/OTM/Common/v0" xmlns:ota2="http://www.opentravel.org/OTM/Common/v0" xmlns:otm="http://www.OpenTravel.org/ns/OTA2/AppInfo_v01_00" xmlns:xsd="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:Library> <otm:LibraryName>OTA_SimpleTypes</otm:LibraryName> <otm:LibraryVersion>0.0.0</otm:LibraryVersion> <otm:SourceFile>/OTA_SimpleTypes_0_0_0.otm</otm:SourceFile> <otm:CompilerVersion>3.1-SNAPSHOT</otm:CompilerVersion> <otm:CompileDate>2014-07-01T10:29:43.055+02:00</otm:CompileDate> </otm:Library> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:import namespace="http://www.OpenTravel.org/ns/OTA2/AppInfo_v01_00" schemaLocation="OTA2_AppInfo_v1.0.0.xsd"/> <xsd:simpleType name="String_AlphaNumeric"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Alpha Numeric string with no whitespace Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 4096</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_AlphaNumeric</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">Abc123</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="4096"/> <xsd:pattern value="([0-9a-zA-Z]+)?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_Long"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A long string Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 4096</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_Long</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">I am a long string.</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="4096"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A string with a minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 512.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">I am a medium string.</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="512"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_Short"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A short string Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 128</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_Short</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">I am a short string.</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="128"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_Tiny"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A tiny string Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 32</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_Tiny</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">I am a tiny string.</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="32"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_Character_One"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Single character string Minimum length of 0 and a maximum length of 1</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_Character_One</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">A</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="1"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_UpperCaseAlpha"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Upper Case Alpha string with no whitespace Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://services.sabre.com/STL/v01}UpperCaseString</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_UpperCaseAlpha</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">ADCDEF</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="4096"/> <xsd:pattern value="([A-Z]+)?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_UpperCaseAlphaNumeric"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Upper Case Alpha Numeric string with no whitespace Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://services.sabre.com/STL/v01}UpperCaseString</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_UpperCaseAlphaNumeric</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">STRING123</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="4096"/> <xsd:pattern value="([A-Z0-9]+)?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="String_Text"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">A string intended for free text Minimum length of 0 and maximum length of 4096</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">String_Text</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:maxLength value="4096"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Airline_IATA"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">IATA defined 2 character airline designator codes, (IATA Airline Coding Directory, Section 3) This type will not support IATA 3 char airline designator codes. There are no IATA 3 char airline codes assigned at this time.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Airline_IATA</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">LH</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([a-zA-Z0-9]{2})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Airline_ICAO"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ICAO defined 3 Letter Airline Code (defined by ICAO 8585)</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Airline_ICAO</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">UAL</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([a-zA-Z]{3})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Airport_IATA"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">IATA defined 3 char airport code or location identifier</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Airport_IATA</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">LGA</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([A-Z]{3})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Airport_ICAO"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ICAO defined 4 char airport or location code as per ICAO doc 7910</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Airport_ICAO</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">KDFW</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([A-Z0-9]{4})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Agency_IATA_Number"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">IATA agency number - An 8-digit numerical code that uniquely identifies travel agencies and other entities engaged in the sale of travel</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Agency_IATA_Number</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">77123456</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([0-9]{8})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Country"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ISO 2 char country code - Preferred country code is the 2 character country code as defined in ISO 3166-1</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Country</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">US</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([a-zA-Z]{2})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Country_ISO_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ISO 3 char country code as defined in ISO 3166-1 standard</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Country_ISO_3</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">USA</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([a-zA-Z]{3})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="FlightNumber_Suffix"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Single upper case letter used to distinguish multiple flights of the same number originating on the same date.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">FlightNumber_Suffix</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">A</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="ota2:String_Character_One"> <xsd:maxLength value="1"/> <xsd:pattern value="([A-Z])?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="DateTime"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">XSD DateTime allows either a time-zone specification or allows the time-zone to be omitted. When omitted, times are "local". XSD DateTime with either a "Z" or a "+/-hh:mm" value are UTC. Time is the time "in the indicated time zone". When a element or attribute has xsd:dateTime type, the data in a message can be either local or UTC and software can easily determine which it is.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">DateTime</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">2010-12-31T11:55:00Z</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:dateTime"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="DateTime_WithTimeZone"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ISO date time type with restriction to assure time has the UTC offset or Z for Zulu. Example: 2010-12-31T11:55:00+06:00 or 2010-12-31T11:55:00Z</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}dateTime</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">DateTime_WithTimeZone</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">2010-12-31T11:55:00+06:00</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:pattern value=".+(Z|[+\-]\d{2}:\d{2})"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Empty"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">An empty string used when the simple content of an element or attribute is to be omitted.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Empty</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Language"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Preferred language code is the 2 character ISO 639-1 defined Language code - common usage</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Language</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">en</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:language"> <xsd:minLength value="2"/> <xsd:maxLength value="2"/> <xsd:pattern value="([a-zA-Z]{2})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Language_ISO_3"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ISO 3 char language code defined in ISO639-2</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Language_ISO_3</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">eng</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:language"/> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="DateTime_Local"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">ISO date time type without UTC offset or Z for Zulu restriction indicating it is representing Local Time Example: 2010-12-31T11:55:00</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}dateTime</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">DateTime_Local</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">2010-12-31T11:55:00</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:dateTime"> <xsd:pattern value=".+T[^Z+\-]+"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Currency"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Currency code - Preferred currencty code is a 3 char currency code as defined in ISO 4127</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Currency</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">USD</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([a-zA-Z]{3})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Railway_Station_IATA"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">IATA codes for railway stations begin with Q, X or Z, except when the station shares the code with an airport.
Railway stations are typically used in air-rail alliances or code sharing agreements (commonly known as "Rail Fly"). Commonly used in Europe</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Railway_Station_IATA</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([A-Z]{3})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Enum_DayOfWeek"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Day of the Week types.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="EnumerationClosed">Enum_DayOfWeek</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="Monday"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Tuesday"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Wednesday"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Thursday"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Friday"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Saturday"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Sunday"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Enum_MonthOfYear"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Month of year types</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="EnumerationClosed">Enum_MonthOfYear</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="January"/> <xsd:enumeration value="February"/> <xsd:enumeration value="March"/> <xsd:enumeration value="April"/> <xsd:enumeration value="May"/> <xsd:enumeration value="June"/> <xsd:enumeration value="July"/> <xsd:enumeration value="August"/> <xsd:enumeration value="September"/> <xsd:enumeration value="October"/> <xsd:enumeration value="November"/> <xsd:enumeration value="December"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="FlightNumber_With_Suffix"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">a 1-4 numeric flight number with an alpha suffix</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">FlightNumber_With_Suffix</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">1234S</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([0-9]{1,4}[A-Z]{1})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_Agency_IATA"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">IATA defined 2 or 3 char code for an agency or airline acting as an agency</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_Agency_IATA</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="OTA2">AA</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="([0-9a-zA-Z]{1,3})?"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> </xsd:schema>

<xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Identifier_oid</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Equivalent context="STL2">Identifier</otm:Equivalent> <otm:Example context="STL2">business_object:9999</otm:Example> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}int</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Percent</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Equivalent context="STL2">Score</otm:Equivalent> <otm:Example context="STL2">65</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:decimal"> <xsd:minInclusive value="0"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_DelayReason"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">IATA 4 character code for flight delay reason</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_DelayReason</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Equivalent context="STL2">ReasonCode.OPS</otm:Equivalent> <otm:Example context="STL2">76</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="[A-Z0-9]{1,4}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Ticket_DocumentNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Character String length 13 to 15 to identify a ticketing document. Also used to identify and EMD (IATA Electronic Miscellaneous Document)</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Ticket_DocumentNumber</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Equivalent context="STL2">StringLength13to15</otm:Equivalent> <otm:Example context="STL2">7242117777256</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="13"/> <xsd:maxLength value="15"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Ticket_CouponNumber"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Ticket_CouponNumber</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Example context="STL2">1</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:integer"> <xsd:minInclusive value="1"/> <xsd:maxInclusive value="4"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="AircraftRegistration"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">2 to 10 character aircraft registration number. Note, IATA SSIM restricts characters to upper case alpa-numeric ( [A-Z0-9]{2,10})</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">AircraftRegistration</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Equivalent context="STL2">AircraftRegistration</otm:Equivalent> <otm:Example context="STL2">N9999Z</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:pattern value="[\S]{2,10}"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Enum_WeightCode"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">This is the pricing units applied - codes:L=Pounds, K=Kilos, P=Pieces</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="EnumerationClosed">Enum_WeightCode</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Kilograms</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="P"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Pieces</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="Code_PRAS"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">PRAS code associated to the service or item.</xsd:documentation> <xsd:documentation source="Implementer">Assigned XSD Type: {http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema}string</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="Simple">Code_PRAS</otm:OTA2Entity> <otm:Equivalent context="STL2">StringLength1to3</otm:Equivalent> <otm:Example context="STL2">200</otm:Example> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:minLength value="1"/> <xsd:maxLength value="3"/> </xsd:restriction> source="STL2">Table name(s): Seat Preference (STP)</xsd:documentation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="EnumerationClosed">Enum_SeatPreference</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> value="Window"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Specific"/> <xsd:enumeration value="Exit"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NonsmokingAisle"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NonsmokingWindow"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NonsmokingBulkhead"/> <xsd:enumeration value="NonsmokingAny"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SmokingAisle"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SmokingWindow"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SmokingBulkhead"/> <xsd:enumeration value="SmokingAny"/> <xsd:enumeration value="AdjacentAisleSeat"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PremiumSeat"/> <xsd:enumeration value="BlockedSeat"/> <xsd:enumeration value="PermanentlyBlockedSeat"/> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType> <xsd:simpleType name="MaritalStatus"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:appinfo> <otm:OTA2Entity type="EnumerationClosed">MaritalStatus</otm:OTA2Entity> </xsd:appinfo> </xsd:annotation> <xsd:restriction base="xsd:string"> <xsd:enumeration value="M"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Married</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="S"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Single</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="W"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Widowed</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> <xsd:enumeration value="U"> <xsd:annotation> <xsd:documentation source="Description">Undefined</xsd:documentation> </xsd:annotation> </xsd:enumeration> </xsd:restriction> </xsd:simpleType>
